member.name: T:Amib.Threading.Internal.EventWaitHandleFactory
member.summary: EventWaitHandleFactory class. This is a static class that creates AutoResetEvent and ManualResetEvent objects. In WindowCE the WaitForMultipleObjects API fails to use the Handle property of XxxResetEvent. It can use only handles that were created by the CreateEvent API. Consequently this class creates the needed XxxResetEvent and replaces the handle if it's a WindowsCE OS.

member.name: M:Amib.Threading.Internal.EventWaitHandleFactory.CreateAutoResetEvent
member.summary: Create a new AutoResetEvent object

member.name: M:Amib.Threading.Internal.EventWaitHandleFactory.CreateManualResetEvent(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a new ManualResetEvent object

member.name: M:Amib.Threading.Internal.EventWaitHandleFactory.ReplaceEventHandle(System.Threading.WaitHandle,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Replace the event handle
member.param: The WaitHandle object which its handle needs to be replaced.
Indicates if the event is a ManualResetEvent (true) or an AutoResetEvent (false)
The initial state of the event

member.summary: A flag to indicate if the Work Items Group is now suspended.

member.summary: Defines how many work items of this WorkItemsGroup can run at once.

member.summary: Priority queue to hold work items before they are passed to the SmartThreadPool.

member.name: F:Amib.Threading.Internal.WorkItemsGroup._workItemsInStpQueue
member.summary: Indicate how many work items are waiting in the SmartThreadPool queue. This value is used to apply the concurrency.

member.name: F:Amib.Threading.Internal.WorkItemsGroup._workItemsExecutingInStp
member.summary: Indicate how many work items are currently running in the SmartThreadPool. This value is used with the Cancel, to calculate if we can send new work items to the STP.

member.summary: A common object for all the work items that this work items group generate so we can mark them to cancel in O(1)

member.name: T:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool
member.summary: Smart thread pool class.

member.name: F:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.DefaultMinWorkerThreads
member.summary: Default minimum number of threads the thread pool contains. (0)

member.name: F:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.DefaultMaxWorkerThreads
member.summary: Default maximum number of threads the thread pool contains. (25)

member.name: F:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.DefaultIdleTimeout
member.summary: Default idle timeout in milliseconds. (One minute)

member.name: F:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.DefaultUseCallerCallContext
member.summary: Indicate to copy the security context of the caller and then use it in the call. (false)

member.name: F:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.DefaultUseCallerHttpContext
member.summary: Indicate to copy the HTTP context of the caller and then use it in the call. (false)

member.name: F:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.DefaultDisposeOfStateObjects
member.summary: Indicate to dispose of the state objects if they support the IDispose interface. (false)

member.name: F:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.DefaultCallToPostExecute
member.summary: The default option to run the post execute (CallToPostExecute.Always)

member.name: F:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.DefaultWorkItemPriority
member.summary: The default work item priority (WorkItemPriority.Normal)

member.name: F:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.DefaultStartSuspended
member.summary: The default is to work on work items as soon as they arrive and not to wait for the start. (false)

member.name: F:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.DefaultThreadPriority
member.summary: The default thread priority (ThreadPriority.Normal)

member.name: F:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.DefaultPostExecuteWorkItemCallback
member.summary: The default post execute method to run. (None) When null it means not to call it.

member.name: F:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.DefaultPerformanceCounterInstanceName
member.summary: The default name to use for the performance counters instance. (null)

member.name: F:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool._workerThreads
member.summary: Dictionary of all the threads in the thread pool.

member.name: F:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool._workItemsQueue
member.summary: Queue of work items.

member.name: F:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool._workItemsProcessed
member.summary: Count the work items handled. Used by the performance counter.

member.name: F:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool._inUseWorkerThreads
member.summary: Number of threads that currently work (not idle).

member.name: F:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool._stpStartInfo
member.summary: Stores a copy of the original STPStartInfo. It is used to change the MinThread and MaxThreads

member.name: F:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool._currentWorkItemsCount
member.summary: Total number of work items that are stored in the work items queue plus the work items that the threads in the pool are working on.

member.name: F:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool._isIdleWaitHandle
member.summary: Signaled when the thread pool is idle, i.e. no thread is busy and the work items queue is empty

member.name: F:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool._shuttingDownEvent
member.summary: An event to signal all the threads to quit immediately.

member.name: F:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool._isSuspended
member.summary: A flag to indicate if the Smart Thread Pool is now suspended.

member.name: F:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool._shutdown
member.summary: A flag to indicate the threads to quit.

member.name: F:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool._threadCounter
member.summary: Counts the threads created in the pool. It is used to name the threads.

member.name: F:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool._isDisposed
member.summary: Indicate that the SmartThreadPool has been disposed

member.name: F:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool._workItemsGroups
member.summary: Holds all the WorkItemsGroup instaces that have at least one work item int the SmartThreadPool This variable is used in case of Shutdown

member.summary: A common object for all the work items int the STP so we can mark them to cancel in O(1)

member.name: M:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.WaitAll(Amib.Threading.IWaitableResult[])
member.summary: Wait for all work items to complete
member.param: Array of work item result objects
member.returns: true when every work item in workItemResults has completed; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.WaitAll(Amib.Threading.IWaitableResult[],System.TimeSpan,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Wait for all work items to complete
member.param: Array of work item result objects
The number of milliseconds to wait, or a TimeSpan that represents -1 milliseconds to wait indefinitely.
true to exit the synchronization domain for the context before the wait (if in a synchronized context), and reacquire it; otherwise, false.
member.returns: true when every work item in workItemResults has completed; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.WaitAll(Amib.Threading.IWaitableResult[],System.TimeSpan,System.Boolean,System.Threading.WaitHandle)
member.summary: Wait for all work items to complete
member.param: Array of work item result objects
The number of milliseconds to wait, or a TimeSpan that represents -1 milliseconds to wait indefinitely.
true to exit the synchronization domain for the context before the wait (if in a synchronized context), and reacquire it; otherwise, false.
A cancel wait handle to interrupt the wait if needed
member.returns: true when every work item in workItemResults has completed; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.WaitAll(Amib.Threading.IWaitableResult[],System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Wait for all work items to complete
member.param: Array of work item result objects
The number of milliseconds to wait, or Timeout.Infinite (-1) to wait indefinitely.
true to exit the synchronization domain for the context before the wait (if in a synchronized context), and reacquire it; otherwise, false.
member.returns: true when every work item in workItemResults has completed; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.WaitAll(Amib.Threading.IWaitableResult[],System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Threading.WaitHandle)
member.summary: Wait for all work items to complete
member.param: Array of work item result objects
The number of milliseconds to wait, or Timeout.Infinite (-1) to wait indefinitely.
true to exit the synchronization domain for the context before the wait (if in a synchronized context), and reacquire it; otherwise, false.
A cancel wait handle to interrupt the wait if needed
member.returns: true when every work item in workItemResults has completed; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.WaitAny(Amib.Threading.IWaitableResult[])
member.summary: Waits for any of the work items in the specified array to complete, cancel, or timeout
member.param: Array of work item result objects
member.returns: The array index of the work item result that satisfied the wait, or WaitTimeout if any of the work items has been canceled.

member.name: M:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.WaitAny(Amib.Threading.IWaitableResult[],System.TimeSpan,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Waits for any of the work items in the specified array to complete, cancel, or timeout
member.param: Array of work item result objects
The number of milliseconds to wait, or a TimeSpan that represents -1 milliseconds to wait indefinitely.
true to exit the synchronization domain for the context before the wait (if in a synchronized context), and reacquire it; otherwise, false.
member.returns: The array index of the work item result that satisfied the wait, or WaitTimeout if no work item result satisfied the wait and a time interval equivalent to millisecondsTimeout has passed or the work item has been canceled.

member.summary: Waits for any of the work items in the specified array to complete, cancel, or timeout

true to exit the synchronization domain for the context before the wait (if in a synchronized context), and reacquire it; otherwise, false.
A cancel wait handle to interrupt the wait if needed
member.returns: The array index of the work item result that satisfied the wait, or WaitTimeout if no work item result satisfied the wait and a time interval equivalent to millisecondsTimeout has passed or the work item has been canceled.

true to exit the synchronization domain for the context before the wait (if in a synchronized context), and reacquire it; otherwise, false.
A cancel wait handle to interrupt the wait if needed
member.returns: The array index of the work item result that satisfied the wait, or WaitTimeout if no work item result satisfied the wait and a time interval equivalent to millisecondsTimeout has passed or the work item has been canceled.

member.name: M:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.AbortOnWorkItemCancel

member.name: M:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.GetStates
member.summary: Get an array with all the state objects of the currently running items. The array represents a snap shot and impact performance.

member.name: M:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.Start
member.summary: Start the thread pool if it was started suspended. If it is already running, this method is ignored.

member.name: P:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.CurrentThreadEntry
member.summary: A reference to the current work item a thread from the thread pool is executing.

member.name: E:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.OnThreadInitialization
member.summary: This event is fired when a thread is created. Use it to initialize a thread before the work items use it.

member.name: E:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.OnThreadTermination
member.summary: This event is fired when a thread is terminating. Use it for cleanup.

member.name: P:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.MinThreads
member.summary: Get/Set the lower limit of threads in the pool.

member.name: P:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.MaxThreads
member.summary: Get/Set the upper limit of threads in the pool.

member.name: P:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.ActiveThreads
member.summary: Get the number of threads in the thread pool. Should be between the lower and the upper limits.

member.name: P:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.InUseThreads
member.summary: Get the number of busy (not idle) threads in the thread pool.

member.name: P:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.IsWorkItemCanceled
member.summary: Returns true if the current running work item has been cancelled. Must be used within the work item's callback method. The work item should sample this value in order to know if it needs to quit before its completion.

member.name: P:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.STPStartInfo
member.summary: Thread Pool start information (readonly)

member.name: P:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.PerformanceCountersReader
member.summary: Return the local calculated performance counters Available only if STPStartInfo.EnableLocalPerformanceCounters is true.

member.name: P:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.Concurrency
member.summary: Get/Set the maximum number of work items that execute cocurrency on the thread pool

member.name: P:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.WaitingCallbacks
member.summary: Get the number of work items in the queue.

member.name: P:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.WIGStartInfo
member.summary: WorkItemsGroup start information (readonly)

member.name: E:Amib.Threading.SmartThreadPool.OnIdle
member.summary: This event is fired when all work items are completed. (When IsIdle changes to true) This event only work on WorkItemsGroup. On SmartThreadPool it throws the NotImplementedException.

member.summary: The last time this thread has been running It is updated by IAmAlive() method The value is stored as UTC value.

member.summary: Get/Set the idle timeout in milliseconds. If a thread is idle (starved) longer than IdleTimeout then it may quit.

member.name: P:Amib.Threading.STPStartInfo.ThreadPriority

member.name: P:Amib.Threading.STPStartInfo.PerformanceCounterInstanceName
member.summary: Get/Set the performance counter instance name of this SmartThreadPool The default is null which indicate not to use performance counters at all.

member.name: P:Amib.Threading.STPStartInfo.EnableLocalPerformanceCounters
member.summary: Enable/Disable the local performance counter. This enables the user to get some performance information about the SmartThreadPool without using Windows performance counters. (Useful on WindowsCE, Silverlight, etc.) The default is false.

members.member:
Initialize the callback holding object.
The workItemGroup of the workitem The WorkItemInfo of te workitem Callback delegate for the callback. State with which to call the callback delegate.
We assume that the WorkItem object is created within the thread that meant to run the callback

member.name: M:Amib.Threading.Internal.WorkItem.StartingWorkItem
member.summary: Change the state of the work item to in progress if it wasn't canceled.
member.returns: Return true on success or false in case the work item was canceled. If the work item needs to run a post execute then the method will return true.

member.name: M:Amib.Threading.Internal.WorkItem.WaitAll(Amib.Threading.IWaitableResult[],System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Threading.WaitHandle)
member.summary: Wait for all work items to complete
member.param: Array of work item result objects
The number of milliseconds to wait, or Timeout.Infinite (-1) to wait indefinitely.
true to exit the synchronization domain for the context before the wait (if in a synchronized context), and reacquire it; otherwise, false.
A cancel wait handle to interrupt the wait if needed
member.returns: true when every work item in waitableResults has completed; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Amib.Threading.Internal.WorkItem.WaitAny(Amib.Threading.IWaitableResult[],System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Threading.WaitHandle)
member.summary: Waits for any of the work items in the specified array to complete, cancel, or timeout
member.param: Array of work item result objects
The number of milliseconds to wait, or Timeout.Infinite (-1) to wait indefinitely.
true to exit the synchronization domain for the context before the wait (if in a synchronized context), and reacquire it; otherwise, false.
A cancel wait handle to interrupt the wait if needed
member.returns: The array index of the work item result that satisfied the wait, or WaitTimeout if no work item result satisfied the wait and a time interval equivalent to millisecondsTimeout has passed or the work item has been canceled.

Timeout in milliseconds, or -1 for infinite
true to exit the synchronization domain for the context before the wait (if in a synchronized context), and reacquire it; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Amib.Threading.IWorkItemResult`1.Cancel
member.summary: Same as Cancel(false).

member.name: M:Amib.Threading.IWorkItemResult`1.Cancel(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Cancel the work item execution. If the work item is in the queue then it won't execute If the work item is completed, it will remain completed If the work item is in progress then the user can check the SmartThreadPool.IsWorkItemCanceled property to check if the work item has been cancelled. If the abortExecution is set to true then the Smart Thread Pool will send an AbortException to the running thread to stop the execution of the work item. When an in progress work item is canceled its GetResult will throw WorkItemCancelException. If the work item is already cancelled it will remain cancelled
member.param: When true send an AbortException to the executing thread.
member.returns: Returns true if the work item was not completed, otherwise false.

member.summary: Gets an indication whether the asynchronous operation has completed.

member.name: P:Amib.Threading.IWorkItemResult`1.IsCanceled
member.summary: Gets an indication whether the asynchronous operation has been canceled.

member.summary: Get the work item's priority

member.name: T:Amib.Threading.Internal.WorkItem.WorkItemState
member.summary: Indicates the state of the work item in the thread pool

member.name: T:Amib.Threading.Internal.STPEventWaitHandle
member.summary: EventWaitHandle class In WindowsCE this class doesn't exist and I needed the WaitAll and WaitAny implementation. So I wrote this class to implement these two methods with some of their overloads. It uses the WaitForMultipleObjects API to do the WaitAll and WaitAny. Note that this class doesn't even inherit from WaitHandle!

members.member:
Returns the WaiterEntry of the current thread
In order to avoid creation and destuction of WaiterEntry objects each thread has its own WaiterEntry object.

member.summary: Push a new waiter into the waiter's stack
member.param: A waiter to put in the stack

member.name: M:Amib.Threading.Internal.WorkItemsQueue.PopWaiter
member.summary: Pop a waiter from the waiter's stack
member.returns: Returns the first waiter in the stack

member.name: M:Amib.Threading.Internal.WorkItemsQueue.RemoveWaiter(Amib.Threading.Internal.WorkItemsQueue.WaiterEntry,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Remove a waiter from the stack
member.param: A waiter entry to remove
If true the waiter count is always decremented

members.member:
Signal the waiter that it got a work item.
Return true on success The method fails if Timeout() preceded its call

Mark the wait entry that it has been timed out
Return true on success The method fails if Signal() preceded its call
